newsitem.title: USA: Bonneville offers no firm, peak power for Friday.
newsitem.headline: Bonneville offers no firm, peak power for Friday.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) refrained from offering firm power during peak demand hours on Friday, the agency said Thursday.
BPA had offered up to 300 megawatts (MW) of firm peak power for Thursday delivery at $16.00 per megawatt hour (MWh) for Northwest deliveries and $17.00 for California-Oregon border (COB) sales.
Friday firm off-peak prices were unchanged at $10.50 per MWh for all deliveries.
BPA also continued not to offer next-day non-firm power during morning and evening peaks (hours ending 0800-1000 and 1800-2000 PST).
Non-firm power prices during shoulder hours (1100-1700 and 2100-2200) were lowered to $10.75 for all deliveries.
Non-firm power during the hour ending 0700 PST on Friday was lowerd to $12.00 (Northwest) and $13.00 (COB).
Non-firm power during off-peak hours on Friday was offered at $10.50 for all deliveries.
BPA also offered displacement power during off-peak hours on Friday at $7.00 and $9.00 per MWh.
